page.title: 04Making Whisky.
page.content: The ingredients which go into making whisky are malted barley,water and yeast. The barley is crushed into grist and seven and a half ton loads of it are loaded into the Masher Warts. After water is passed through the grist at increasing temperatures it lies for seven and a half hours and then the wet grist called "Graft" is put into the stills.Once in the still it is boiled and vapour rises.As the vapour cools it runs away as a clear alcoholic liquid. The Distillery produces 14,000 litres of whisky a day.The whisky has to be stored in Oak Barrels for at least 3 years before becoming real whisky. During this time the barrels affect the colour of the liquid and it turns to its usual tan colour.
